repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project (SAL II)

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Structural Adjustment Loan in
            Hungary. The objectives of the project were as follows: (a)
            reducing the role of the state in the economy( reduction of
            administrative intervention in resource allocation, the size
            of the state-owned enterprise  sector, transfers and taxes);
            (b) intensifying competition( import and price
            liberalization, developing strict bankruptcy law); (c)
            reforming the financial sector, within the framework of a
            new Banking Law (liberalization, improved prudential
            regulations, and enhanced supervision); and (d) establishing
            a financially viable and well targeted social safety net.
            The Bank's performance was highly satisfactory in
            project identification, preparation assistance, and
            appraisal and Bank's supervision was satisfactory.
            Borrower performance during preparation was highly
            satisfactory however, the Borrower performance in
            implementing the project should be considered, on balance,
            as mixed. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            prudent macroeconomic management is crucial to the success
            of transformation; (ii) partial implementation of a reform
            package may not allow for overall satisfactory results;
            (iii) reforms of the public sector in transition economies
            are even more difficult to implement than the initial
            liberalization and building of competitive markets; and (iv)
            transition economies remain strongly vulnerable to the
            external environment.

repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            (SAL 2) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project will support the Government's medium-term
            economic reform program, which represents an acceleration
            and deepening of reforms implemented successfully since the
            beginning of 1990 and supported by the First Structural
            Adjustment Loan (SAL 1). The objective of the reforms is to
            establish a competitive market economy in Hungary, and to
            preserve Hungary's external creditworthiness. The
            program has four main components: (a) reduction of the role
            of the state -- regarding ownership of productive assets,
            the extent of administrative intervention in resource
            allocation, and the amount of resources redistributed
            through taxes and transfers; (b) intensification of
            competition, by way of further liberalization, the promotion
            of new private ventures, implementation of effective
            anti-trust action against enterprises engaged in unfair and
            restrictive practices, and tightening of financial
            discipline through the financial system and strengthened
            bankruptcy procedures; (c) financial sector reform, through
            further liberalization, implementation of improved
            prudential regulation and tighter supervision, and
            restructuring of insolvent banks; and (d) establishment of
            financially viable well-targeted, and efficient programs of
            social assistance to alleviate the social costs of
            adjustment and to provide an adequate social safety net that
            will protect the poor.
